result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Charges read in for sentencing on 15CM496
Charges read in for sentencing on 15CM496

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory K. Meyer

defendant.name: Meyer, Gregory K.
defendant.address: 17 W. Prospect Street, Apt. A, Rhinelander, WI 54501

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:50 p.,m. Defendant Gregory K. Meyer in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm32 and 15cm496. State moves to dismiss 16cm32 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to 15cm496. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year - concurrent 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:03 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:42 Defendant Gregory K. Meyer in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Gregory K. Meyer in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In receipt, waive reading - Voorhees not yet appointed on this case - but represents on underlying case -will proceed with today's hearing - Enters not guilty plea today 
Court will intra circuit to Br II - 
Schiek to bail - Voorhees statement - Court sets $ sig bond  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
